017package org.apache.juneau.commons.lang;
018
019/**
020 * Listener interface for monitoring value changes in {@link Value} objects.
021 *
022 * <p>
023 * This functional interface allows you to register a callback that will be invoked whenever a {@link Value}'s
024 * content is changed via the {@link Value#set(Object)} method. This is useful for logging, validation,
025 * synchronization, or triggering side effects when values change.
026 *
027 * <p>
028 * Only one listener can be registered per {@link Value} object. Setting a new listener will replace any
029 * previously registered listener.
030 *
031 * <h5 class='section'>Usage:</h5>
032 * <p>
033 * The listener is triggered every time {@link Value#set(Object)} is called, including when setting
034 * to <jk>null</jk>. Other methods like {@link Value#getAndSet(Object)} also trigger the listener
035 * since they call {@code set()} internally.
036 *
037 * <h5 class='section'>Examples:</h5>
038 * <p class='bjava'>
039 *    <jc>// Simple logging listener</jc>
040 *    Value&lt;String&gt; <jv>value</jv> = Value.<jsm>of</jsm>(<js>"initial"</js>);
041 *    <jv>value</jv>.listener(<jv>newValue</jv> -&gt; <jsm>System.out</jsm>.println(<js>"Value changed to: "</js> + <jv>newValue</jv>));
042 *    <jv>value</jv>.set(<js>"updated"</js>);  <jc>// Prints "Value changed to: updated"</jc>
043 *
044 *    <jc>// Validation listener</jc>
045 *    Value&lt;Integer&gt; <jv>age</jv> = Value.<jsm>of</jsm>(0);
046 *    <jv>age</jv>.listener(<jv>newAge</jv> -&gt; {
047 *       <jk>if</jk> (<jv>newAge</jv> != <jk>null</jk> &amp;&amp; <jv>newAge</jv> &lt; 0) {
048 *          <jk>throw new</jk> IllegalArgumentException(<js>"Age cannot be negative"</js>);
049 *       }
050 *    });
051 *
052 *    <jc>// Synchronization listener</jc>
053 *    Value&lt;String&gt; <jv>primary</jv> = Value.<jsm>of</jsm>(<js>"data"</js>);
054 *    Value&lt;String&gt; <jv>secondary</jv> = Value.<jsm>empty</jsm>();
055 *    <jv>primary</jv>.listener(<jv>secondary</jv>::set);  <jc>// Keep secondary in sync with primary</jc>
056 *    <jv>primary</jv>.set(<js>"new data"</js>);
057 *    <jsm>assertEquals</jsm>(<jv>primary</jv>.get(), <jv>secondary</jv>.get());
058 *
059 *    <jc>// Accumulator listener</jc>
060 *    IntegerValue <jv>sum</jv> = IntegerValue.<jsm>create</jsm>();
061 *    Value&lt;Integer&gt; <jv>number</jv> = Value.<jsm>of</jsm>(0);
062 *    <jv>number</jv>.listener(<jv>n</jv> -&gt; <jv>sum</jv>.set(<jv>sum</jv>.get() + (<jv>n</jv> != <jk>null</jk> ? <jv>n</jv> : 0)));
063 *    <jv>number</jv>.set(5).set(10).set(15);  <jc>// sum = 30</jc>
064 * </p>
065 *
066 * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
067 *    <li class='note'>
068 *       The listener is called <b>after</b> the value has been changed, so {@link Value#get()} will return
069 *       the new value.
070 *    <li class='note'>
071 *       The listener is <b>not</b> called by {@link Value#getAndUnset()}, as that method sets the value to
072 *       <jk>null</jk> directly without going through {@link Value#set(Object)}.
073 *    <li class='note'>
074 *       Exceptions thrown by the listener will propagate to the caller of {@link Value#set(Object)}.
075 *    <li class='note'>
076 *       This interface is a functional interface and can be used with lambda expressions or method references.
077 * </ul>
078 *
079 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
080 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/JuneauCommonsLang">Lang Package</a>
081 *    <li class='jc'>{@link Value}
082 * </ul>
083 *
084 * @param <T> The type of value being monitored.
085 */
086@FunctionalInterface
087public interface ValueListener<T> {
088
089   /**
090    * Called whenever {@link Value#set(Object)} is invoked on the associated {@link Value} object.
091    *
092    * <p>
093    * This method is called <b>after</b> the value has been updated, so calling {@link Value#get()} on the
094    * associated value object will return the new value.
095    *
096    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
097    * <p class='bjava'>
098    *    Value&lt;String&gt; <jv>value</jv> = Value.<jsm>of</jsm>(<js>"old"</js>);
099    *    <jv>value</jv>.listener((<jv>newValue</jv>) -&gt; {
100    *       <jsm>System.out</jsm>.println(<js>"Changed to: "</js> + <jv>newValue</jv>);
101    *    });
102    *    <jv>value</jv>.set(<js>"new"</js>);  <jc>// Prints "Changed to: new"</jc>
103    * </p>
104    *
105    * @param newValue The new value that was set. Can be <jk>null</jk>.
106    */
107   void onSet(T newValue);
108}
